intro: Thesium bibracteatum, commonly known as the two-bract thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and is native to southern Africa. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Thesium bibracteatum is adapted to arid and rocky environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
